text: how many orgs have Design Systems it
seems like I I tend to have a very Indie
lens so I'm always scaling up to largers
but I know that Design Systems are
things that we talk about a lot on
podcast and there's people who like go
and teach how to have a design system
but I feel like this is something that
like high quality well-invested orgs
have but most of us don't have I see a
lot of startups with Design Systems as
well um it depends on what you define as
Design Systems right like oh yeah okay
material design is a design system used
by like thousands of companies right or
you have ant design or these open source
Design Systems right I would still count
that as the company having a design
system even though they didn't build it
right they're using a design system uh
and if you think about it like that the
vast majority are are using some kind of
design system I think like that's not an
official stat it's just like that's the
feeling I get sure that's fair I just
think that to a certain extent it is a
barrier to getting started but maybe
because of Open Source and because of
the proliferation of at least lowcost
available Design Systems you could get
started relatively easy maybe like the
you know steps you know two or three of
startup is like business idea right some
sort of uh feature list or go to market
strategy and then like some kind of a
design system so you can start building
that thing yeah but also Design Systems
aren't a binary thing it's not like you
either have or you don't have one even
like you know week one as a startup
you'll probably be like um
